cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles west of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then slowing and turning north toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Mississippi) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana–Mississippi coast (near the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama/Florida border to Ochlockonee River FL (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central and northern Gulf Coast from west-central Florida to Louisiana/Mississippi
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (guidance 1–3 ft north of port, <1–2 ft near Port Manatee)
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible through Saturday night into early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible, generally below 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized higher totals could cause temporary ponding and minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and a low tornado risk Saturday night
